column4: Is there a way to permanently change ubuntu grub-config (so that it wont change when I upgrade my kernel)?
set up your own menu choices and ignore the ubuntu-maintained ones
Trouble is that every time I upgrade my kernel (whether it be vanilla or ubuntu's) my /boot/grub/menu.lst is changed so I get the splash-screen

yes, but if you check what is actually changed, it is the menu items that ubuntu has put in there, so just add your own and boot with those - you might even exchange the names of ubuntu's kernel and initrd for your own, so they won't be changed either
